meanings.definition: The act of moving an aircraft on the ground under its own power.
meanings.sent1: The taxying of the airplane was smooth and steady.
meanings.sent2: The taxying of the jet on the runway was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The taxying of the helicopter made the pilot feel like a skilled captain.
meanings.sent4: The taxying of the small plane resembled a graceful dance on the tarmac.
meanings.sent5: The taxying of the aircraft was as precise as a well-choreographed performance.

meanings.definition: The act of moving a vehicle slowly and carefully in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: The taxying of the car in the parking lot required patience.
meanings.sent2: The taxying of the truck down the narrow alley was challenging.
meanings.sent3: The taxying of the bicycle through the crowd was like navigating a maze.
meanings.sent4: The taxying of the bus through traffic felt like a delicate balancing act.
meanings.sent5: The taxying of the scooter was as cautious as a tiptoe through a quiet room.

meanings.definition: The act of moving in a specified direction in a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The taxying of the boat along the river was peaceful.
meanings.sent2: The taxying of the train through the countryside was scenic.
meanings.sent3: The taxying of the skateboard down the ramp was thrilling.
meanings.sent4: The taxying of the motorcycle on the highway felt liberating.
meanings.sent5: The taxying of the car on the winding road was like a journey through nature.
